div.em: Current conditions as of 24 Apr 07:15 am CDT

div.div: A slight chance of showers between 2pm and 4pm, then a chance of showers and thunderstorms after 4pm. Widespread dense fog, mainly before 8am. Otherwise, mostly cloudy, with a high near 67. Calm wind becoming south 5 to 7 mph in the afternoon. Chance of precipitation is 30%.

A chance of showers and thunderstorms before 8pm, then showers likely and possibly a thunderstorm between 8pm and 1am, then showers likely after 1am. Cloudy, with a low around 53. South southeast wind 5 to 8 mph becoming east northeast after midnight. Chance of precipitation is 70%. New rainfall amounts between a quarter and half of an inch possible.

Showers. High near 57. East northeast wind 10 to 15 mph becoming north in the afternoon. Winds could gust as high as 22 mph. Chance of precipitation is 90%. New precipitation amounts between a half and three quarters of an inch possible.

h3.a: Summer Date set for Shelby County Health Dept Physicals - June 25, 2020

img.alt: Image result for free medical graphics

div.p: There will be a physical examination clinic held on June 25, 2020 at 7 Fox Meadow Lane, 1st Baptist Church, Moweaqua. Physical examinations are required for children entering Kindergarten, sixth grade, and ninth grade. They are also required for all students participating in athletics.
Students report in the morning for the preliminary work-up at 9:30 AM. The physicians will be present at 10:30 AM to complete the physical exam.

p.br: There will be a $20.00 charge for the physical examination. Make checks payable to the Shelby County Health Department. Medical cards are excepted.

a.aria-label: Read more about Summer Date set for Shelby County Health Dept Physicals - June 25, 2020

div.p: Dear Central A&M Parents, Faculty and Staff,

I want to take this opportunity to provide you with an update and some valuable information about the COVID-19. Around the nation, school administration are staying updated on a daily basis about the COVID-19 situation. As a district we will be following any guidance that comes forth from the Centers for Disease Control, Illinois Department of Public Health and the Shelby/Christian/Macon County Health Departments. Currently, outside of self-quarantine for those knowingly exposed to the virus, there are no specific steps to take, other than to continue to practice good hygiene habits:

ul.li: Avoid close contact with people who are sick.
Avoid touching your eyes, nose, and mouth.
Stay home when you are sick.
Cover your cough or sneeze with a tissue, then throw the tissue in the trash.
Clean and disinfect frequently touched objects and surfaces using a regular household cleaning spray or wipe.
Wash your hands often with soap and water for at least 20 seconds, especially after going to the bathroom; before eating; and after blowing your nose, coughing, or sneezing.
If soap and water are not readily available, use an alcohol-based hand sanitizer with at least 60% alcohol. Always wash hands with soap and water if hands are visibly dirty.

div.p: Additionally, as we do every year at this time of year, frequently touched surfaces get increased cleaning and we utilize a cordless electrostatic sprayer to boost our disinfection efforts. Further, teachers, staff and administration encourage students to cover coughs/sneezes and remind them to wash hands often and effectively.
The CDC website has information and resources about not only the COVID-19, but influenza as well. The links below are helpful in terms of disease prevention and information on the issue.
https://www.cdc.gov/coronavirus/2019-ncov/index.html
https://www.isbe.net/Documents/2019-nCoV-Guidance-for-K-12-Schools.pdf#search=Coronavirus
We also urge you to stay updated, on your own, through other credible sources.
Dr. Heck

div.p: Over the past few years, CAM District 21 administration and staff, the Moweaqua and Assumption Chiefs of Police and Police Departments have studied the driving and parking issues and safety concerns at our schools and have put in place the following changes for the 2019-20 school year. We know that these changes will cause frustration while we learn new pathways, but, please be patient and kind. As in any change, there may be things that need fixing or tweaking. Please call either the police departments: Moweaqua - 217-768-2160, Assumption - 217-226-3742, or the CAM District Office - 217-226-4042 if you have any concerns.

IN MOWEAQUA -- Effective August 19, 2019 drivers will no longer be able to make a left turn into parking spaces, back into parking spaces, back out of a parking space and go east (opposite direction of travel) or making U-Turns during school hours while children are in school.
There will be signs posted and police officers out educating all drivers of the changes. After a period of time, you may be subjected to being cited for the sign violations.

We also added a bus loading zone in front of Gregory Intermediate and moved the handicapped parking to the west by the teachers parking (Signs will be posted and the ground marked) to get the bus closer to the sidewalk for safer loading and unloading of our students. It will be marked off by yellow lines and it is not to be used for any other purpose. You still need to stop when the bus activates its red lights and the stop arm is out for both directions of travel on Pine during loading and unloading.
For those who use the Handicapped Parking the spaces provided are to be used to park and exit your vehicle for school related business and is not to be used to park and wait to pick up your students.
If you have any questions about the changes please contact the Moweaqua Police Department at 217-768-2160, which is the direct line to the Chief of Police.

IN ASSUMPTION -- Effective August 19, 2019 the vehicle entrance and exit at the middle school will be changing. Drivers will enter at the east entrance of the Middle School and exit from the west entrance. Students (both Bond and MS) will be dropped off at the front doors- MS students will enter into the east side of the front doors, Bond students will enter the west side of the front doors. Staff will be present at the doors to take the Bond students to their correct locations; MS students will need to go to their lockers and follow teacher guidance. There is a designated BUS lane at the front of the school. This lane will be ONLY wide enough for one vehicle. If buses are loading at this area, you will not be able to pass them, so plan accordingly. If parents need to come into the MS office at any time during the school day, they will need park in the parking lot, not in the BUS lane and come in. There is to be no vehicle parking in the BUS lane at the Middle School at any time, including during after school events.
Shuttle students can be dropped off and catch their shuttle at the west corner of the building (gym locker room side).

The back of the MS building will be inaccessible to cars during drop off 7:00-8:30 AM and pick up 2:00-4:00 PM. BUSES only will drop off students at the East doors for MS students and the Bond office door for Bond students. During the day hours of 8:30 - 2:00 parents of Bond children may use the east side lane to go to the back of the building if they come to BOND school. There will be minimal parking in the back for parents who need to come to the Bond office. There will be a metal arm on the west side of the building that will be closed throughout the day for student playground safety. Please be cautious as you exit the Bond parking lot (during the hours of 8:30 AM-2:00 PM); you will need to turn around and exit on the east side of the building.

p.b: Shuttle TIMES and locations for ALL schools:
Moweaqua to Assumption shuttle (UNCHANGED FROM LAST YEAR):

div.p: MS students -- 7:25 AM - East side of HS
Bond students -- 7:45 AM - HS cafeteria doors
HS students -- 7:25 AM
Gregory students -- 7:45 AM
All Assumption shuttles will be located at the west corner (gym- locker rooms) of the MS building
If you have questions regarding drop off and pick up of shuttle please call your building principal.

Thank you to everyone for their cooperation! We understand it will take some time for everyone to learn the new changes. Please remember that these changes are for the safety of all students that are being dropped off or picked up at the school and to avoid any vehicle collisions with any other vehicles. It's a brand new school year and a GREAT one to be a RAIDER!
